title: Good set. A bit overpriced. Sturdy.
text: Good set. I got this on a lightning deal and I probably wouldn't buy it at full price. I bought it for my 4 and 2 year old and we all like it. We don't really need 6 of the wands and I wish they would have diversified. The wands are the strongest magnets in the box though. The other smaller magnets aren't very strong, though the horseshoe is strong enough. We like the variety of balls and chips. And I love that they provided a nice storage box!! It opens nicely and is sturdy. Everything goes back in with room to spare, so no cramming. So overall a quality product, a bit overpriced, with some really good features and some smaller magnets that need to be stronger to be very useful. I'm glad I bought it (at a lightning deal price).

title: Another Beautiful Puzzle
text: We love Darrell Bush's puzzles. They are all very beautiful. Even though they are 1,000 pieces, they are not terribly difficult to put together. In each area there is enough color difference to recognize what pieces go in which area. The only aspect that gave us a little difficulty with this puzzle was that there were a couple of pieces cut a certain way that allowed them to fit in multiple spots. Not many pieces were like this. And luckily we were able to figure it out. Overall, I highly recommend this puzzle and all of Darrell Bush's puzzles for jigsaw puzzle fans.

title: Great for artist, great gift, need better way to clean the board
text: We love Osmo.  We received the Frozen one as a gift from my our Nana.  We have all the other Disney Osmo Studioi sets.  I only gave it 4 stars as the erasers that come with these sets don't do much for it and we use only the yoobi dry erase markers that come with the set.  We have the Art Osmo Creative Starter kit as well.  My son likes the Creative Design kit but really hasn't shown any interests in the Super Studio Learn to Draw sets who is 7 but he doesn't like to draw or color.  My 5 yo daughter who is my artist loves this.  She draws and colors daily so these are her favorite Osmo games.  She was super stoked about her new Frozen II Osmo set.  I highly recommend them for those little artists out there.  Note, the microfiber cloth is not really good at cleaning up the dry erase markers but I found a good solution for this.  We use a Clorox Wipe to clean it and get it wet and then we run a Magic Eraser and the pads are completely clean and look like new.  We have all of the Studio Design pads and this seems to clean all of them.  Hope this helps.

title: Great accessory for Osmo, need a better eraser!
text: Let me first say, we LOVE Osmo.  We have all of the Drawing Sets, Awbie games, etc.  The Disney Drawing sets are great and my 5 yo daughter LOVES them.  My only issue with them is that the eraser provided doesn't work as well and it always take some adult help erasing the Osmo sheets.  Also, we end up using a Magic Eraser to get the markers off.  However, the fact my daughter can make some of her color creatings come to life is a huge + for me.  She loves drawing in general but getting to make some of her Princesses come to life is great.  The Princess set is her favorite.  The price point is on par for Osmo.  I wouldn't pay anymore than $20 for this.

title: Great bedtime reading with kiddos!
text: I was hesitent to buy this given all the reviews however I got mine for under $10 on Amazon around Christmas time along with some other book titles.  1) I agree it takes some getting use to but once you do it a few times you get the hang of it and I don't have the issues with the projector moving around as much.  2) this doesn't work with my iPhone case (I.e. I've got an otterbox) but that's ok with me.  I knew that going into buying this so this might be a non starter for some.  My kids only use with me so I don't mind taking my otter box my phone and using this (note I'm using this with my iPhone 8 Plus).  I've not used with our iPad but will update review once we do.  3) my kids LOVE this.  They love reading the stories on our ceiling.  We pile up in my bed (my kids are 5 and 7) and read bedtime stories on the ceiling 4) it has music which is a nice touch or you can mute it but the sound effects can be cute in some of the books 5) the selection of some popular books is a great touch, although we have most them in hard back or paper form they love having some of these titles on our Moonlite 6) family bonding, while we do read books before bed this adds a nice touch to change it up and make it more fun, my kids truly get excited to read our moonlite stories so although this doesn't replace our nightly routine stories given we only have about 6 titles right now it's a great supplement to change up the routine and make story time even more fun.  I highly recommend this if you have young kids and are looking for something to make bed time reading more fun.

title: Broken, melted rabbit
text: My daughter loves these Disney Doorables.  She will be 5 in a few weeks.  I bought two of the blind box sets which we haven't opened up yet.  The pic shown is the box set my mom awnt her as an early birthday present.  We have the mega play set and 3 of the smaller play sets which she deceived for Christmas.  I am giving this three stars because we do love the Disney doorables and we haven't opened up our two other sets yet but felt the need to note that one of our doorables came deformed.  Of course it was the furry rare one.  The rabbits ears were broken off and looks like they were melted as other have noted so I am guessing this was a quality control issue.  I'm hoping it was isolated as we have two more boxes she's getting as birthday presents but overall we are happy the Disney Doorables and love the ones we have.  Hopefully the two other blind boxes are not duds like this one.  However I would recommend the Disney Doorable sets in general.  My daughter loves not only opening them up but loves playing with them as well.

title: Great fun for kids!  Messy but fun!
text: I bought one of these as a big box store for $10 more.  I loved ours so much that I bought mine on Amazon for my sister kids.  I have 4yo daughter and 6yo son who has Autism and both my kids love this set.  Note, as other have reviewed it is very messy so this is not an activity where you can leave your kids to do on their own.  This is definetly a family activity unless you have an older child who can help.  My 13 yo babysitter did this activity with them with no problem but note it did make a mess so it requieres clean up but I would recommend regardless if you don't mind the mess.  Used some plastic disposable table cloths underneath to contain the mess.  Kids had a blast making fun things with this (i.e. pizza, bacon, ice cream, etc). If you are looking for a fun family activity than this is your item.  If you are looking for something for more independent play than I would not recommend this item.  Note, my sisters kids are 13 yo and 9 and they loved this set as well.  My sister and I did the same thing, we would make the orbeez early in week and let them play with those for a few days storing them every night in plastic containter and by end of week used the beads for the orbeez crush set that way our kids got multiple uses out of the beads.

title: Great Valentine gift for Little
text: Got this as a Valentine gift for my 4yo daughter who loves shopkin.  These are her favorite shopkins.  Definetly recommend as a great valentine gift for child.

title: Started acting up when I changed the batteries, disappointed in longevity
text:
Mix feelings about this product. Had it over a year with minimal travel usage. We usually leave it in our dining room on our kids table so they can do activities while mom cooks. We loved it when it worked but once the batteries died and I replaced the device with new batteries, it turns on and does nothing. It doesn't sense the stylus. It will on a random occasion after multiple attempts say one or two words when pointed on the stylus but then stops again. Changed batteries out a couple of times and unfortunately didn't help. Now, I have two disappointed kids with numerous of these books and told family to get more books for Christmas which will only be to their disappointment that they have no device to use them with.

As for when the device worked, we would loved it and would recommend to any parent with kids under 7. My son is almost 5yo son and 3yo daughter love this. They take turns using it since I only had one of the Leap Start devices but numerous books. My daughter was heart broken after multiple attempts to try new batteries.

I hate to give one start but given the longevity of this product for the price, it needs to last more than a year. I mean one year for a $45 device. Maybe some would say that's worth it but not when you shell out $10 - $15 on each of the books. I might of gotten a faulty device so maybe it's just poor luck on my part.

UPDATE—7/1118
We've had our new leapstart book (this time I bought at big box store with a warranty) for 5 months now since the last broke, so far so good but I'm still not sure on longevity still, however i have changed batteries a few times since we use ours alot and have had no issues. I am adding a star as my kids fight over this all the time. I've got 6yo boy who LOVES it who is also my reader and 4yo girl who always wants what her brother has but genuinely love this thing. I struggle with getting my kids to play with their $100 toy they got for Christmas but love this thing and it's a plus for me since it's educational. So i still can't give this item as high of a star as I would like because of durability I would recommend it if you don't care if you have to replace it. I'm glad I did but recommend getting some warranty because after investing in the books and how much my kids like It, you may want to get another.

title: Wing already broke with only two weeks of use
text: The ship itself is super cool however, if you are buying this outside of the use as a collectible, it breaks easily.  I bought my 4 year old this for Christmas along with numerous Star Wars Hot Wheels Cars and Ships.  This is the only one that broke.  My son isn't really hard on toys so I was really surprised it broke but unlike the other Ships, the wings are made of plastic instead of the heavy metal.  The center piece is metal but the plastic wing already came off.  I am going to try and "super glue" it back on but please note, this one probably won't hold up to much playing with.  We've had no issues with any of the other ships or toys.  I am super bummed as my son and I love Darth Vader so we both were super stoked about this ship.

title: Warm Sulley Costume
text: Since this is a 4-6, I expected it to be a little big.  My son is 3 but a true Size 4.  This fit him but it was a little big.  He definetly will be able to wear it next Halloween as well.  We just rolled up the sleeves once in the arms so it fit better there.  FYI...the tail does not stay on. We ended up just not wearing it.  It was too much of a hassle.  The costume is also very warm so that is good if your kiddos are wearing this outside for Halloween however, inside they may get hot quick,  Overall, it's a cute costume and I was pleased with my purchase.

title: Kid tested, mother approved!  Two Thumps up!
text: We have all the other Paw Patrol Characters and vehicles and my kids were stoked to get Everest.  I have a 3 1/2 year old boy and 22 month old girl and these sets by far are their favorite toys to play with.  They 22 month old daughter was super stoked to get Everest.  I also bought this for my 6 year old nephew who is into Paw Patrol and he was stoked to get this for his birthday.  Everest is his favorite dog.  Can't say enough good things about this set.  They are sturdy and have endured lots of abuse since last Christmas so this mom gives it two thumps up!  Also, skip the lookout set.  Waste of money and tips over all the time.  Kids never play with it.  Even got a replacement slide from the manufacturer and neither stayed on.  Buy the Paw Patroller.  Way cooler and they can use their characters with the cars with the Paw Patroller.

title: Kids love their sorting clock
text: Love this sorting clock.  Both my 1 1/2 year old and 3 1/2 year old both playing with this.  I got this for my son's 3rd birthday and he loves it.  He's really into colors and shapes and counting so this is great.  My one year old loves it too.  I think this will also be extremely helpful when we get to learning time as well.  Great product by Melissa & Doug.  I even bought one for a friend.  Highly recommend.

title: Rubble on the Double, great Paw Patrol toy

Super happy with this toy purchase.  My one 1/2 year old daughter loves playing with these as well.  Rubble is our favorite because we have a bulldog.

title: Flimsy and pricey toy but I wanted to love it
text: I bought this for my almost 3 year old time for Christmas who is not very hard on toys but the slide on this thing never stays on here.  After about 4 months of use it stopped staying on there.  I don't want to say this isn't a cute toy because my son who loves Paw Patrol and has all the characters loved this toy however, he barely uses it because the slide won't stay on there and toy tips over.  The badge on the front does come off and plays Ryder talking or the theme song and so thats a bonus as both of my kids like to run around and play with that.  The telescope is truly a little telescope but neither of my kids really played with that.  Given the slide issue and it doesn't stay up, I can only give two stars because they rarely get to play with it given those two factors.  I really wanted to love this but just can't recommend this pricey toy.

title: My kids favorite toy!  Best toddler toy!
text: I am giving it 4 out of 5 stars just because the coins get stuck frequently when you put in the change portion.  The coins aren't smooth so they get stuck frequently and I spend a lot of time getting them unstuck.  However, I will say this is my kids favorite toy ever!  I have a 1 1/2 year old girl and 3 year old boy and both end up fighting over every day.  They both love this toy.  It swaps between the kids room, the living room and my bed room (Yes, I woke up to find on of the coins in my bed).  I had a similar toy as a kid (FisherPrice one) and it was one of my favorite toys.  I am glad I bought this one for the kids (I didn't realize it would be such a hit).  I will say, you will need to keep track of the 9 coins and card and dollar bill.  It seems like a full time job for mommy but best $15 I ever spent on a toy.  Kids love it so mom loves it!

title: Toddler still loves it!  Great for convertible car seats!
text: One of the best baby purchases I've bought.  I purchased this because my son was out of his infant car seat at 6 months and we had to transition him to a convertible car seat and since there was no bar for his hanging toy I bought this for a long 8 hour road trip.  My son is now 2 and I've since tooken it off the car seat so we can transition it to my newborn daughters car seat when she transitions to the convertible car seat.  My 2 yo son still loves this.  I brought it up in his sissy's room and use it on her rock and play sleeper when I am pumping and she loves looking at it.  My son was very mad that she now has it and when not looking carries it around the house with him.  He literally still loves this thing.  We used it every day until he was about 18 months in the car (basically because I was tired of hooking it on and off).  I am sure if I wanted to my son would still love the thing on his car seat.  It hooked on great on my Britax Pavillion…I did struggle to keep it on my Safety 1st Pro Air Convertible Car Seat.  I've never tried it on my Chicco Key Fit because we have the bar to hang other toys on.  I have used it on my Fisher Price Rock and Play Sleeper when I've had my daughter in there while pumping and she loved looking at it.  Also, again my toddler loves walking around and playing with it still.  When I purchased this, I didn't think this would be such a staple purchase but I am very glad I made this purchase and would recommend this to anyone with a convertible car seat.

title: Great present that spans generations
text: We bought my son Mr and Mrs. Potato Head for Christmas. He was almost 2 yo. He loves them! He loves for me to put them together and then him to take apart. My nephews have a slew of these as well and they are 5 and 9 and they still play with theirs. Honestly, I think they are still fun to put together and I am a grown adult. Great toy that spans generations!

title: Great coloring for toddlers
text: I have a 2 year old and I kept hearing horror stories of friend's children coloring their walls.  (I am guilty of doing this also as a child) so I've been hesistant to let my son color except when in the high chair.  I love the whole Crayola Color wonder idea.  We use these pads and their other coloring books with our small color wonder markers all the time.  My son colors with crayons at daycare so he's super excited to color with these markers and coloring pages.  Super excited that they have these pads that are plain so as he gets older he can color or draw whatever he wants with mommy having piece of mind that her couch or walls are safe.  :)

title: Cute but flimsy
text: I was hesistant in buying this in the first place because I don't like my toddler using our iPhone or our iPad but thought it would something fun and interactive that we could bring when we traveled.  We love Little People products and the regular farm set is his favorite.  My son is 2 and I think this would be better suited for maybe a 4 year old.  The app is very interactive and lets him explore the farm and meet other animals, farm, etc.  Again, I think the premise if very good and my son will get more use as he gets older but I am displeased with the set up and flimsy case.  It's definitely work getting the iPad in and out of the case for this which is good and bad.  Good because they toddler can't get my iPad out but bad because it's hard getting the thing to show up on the right side correctly.  The iPad wants to flip to whatever side you are viewing thus you have to put the iPad just right otherwise it displays upside down.  Once you get past that there are some settings you have to configure and then finally the case on the top in my opinion is very flimsy.  My son has already scratched the case on the top (not my iPad thankfully) with adult supervision.  I never let him play with this by himself.  I try to play and interact with him as I am not about to hand over my iPad to a 2 year old.  To sum it up, it's a cute concept, I love Little People but I just don't think the case is very sturdy as I am afraid if I walked away my two year old let alone a 4 year old would be able poke a hole in the screen case real easy and onto my iPad.

title: Great gift for 2 year old
text: Bought this a gift for a friend's 2 year old who was very pleased with this set.  He was actually super excited and is a great step up from the Mega Blocks but before moving into the regular Lego's.  FYI...I love the box sets too as they come in these reusable boxes to put the duplo's back in for reuse versus some of the other sets that come in small boxes that get thrown away.

title: Cute toddler toy
text: Bought this for my son who was about 18 months for Christmas.  He loves Little People stuff and this toy was perfect as he loves Toy Story.  We bought the Toy Story RC and Woody too which his favorite but he likes this as well.  We had the Little People plane which is similar to this so I was hesitatnt to buy this but he loves it as he loves Toy Story and loves playing with the Buzz character.

title: Fun toy for toddlers
text: Bought this for my son who was about 18 months for Christmas.  He loves Little People stuff and this toy was perfect as he loves Toy Story.  We bought the Buz Light Year Spacechip as well and he likes it also but this one is his favorite as you can push down on the back of the RC's tail and it moves forward.  Super cute for young toddlers.

title: Classic and still popular
text: We bought my son Mr and Mrs. Potato Head for Christmas.  He was almost 2 yo.  He loves them!  He loves for me to put them together and then him to take apart.  My nephews have a slew of these as well and they are 5 and 9 and they still play with theirs.  Honestly, I think they are still fun to put together and I am a grown adult.  Great toy that spans generations!

title: Love these for toddlers!
text: I started using these when my son was 1 and 1/2 with the color wonder coloring books.  He loves them!  He just turned 2 and he loves playing with these.  He colors all the time at daycare but he doesn't get markers very often so at home I get these out because I don't have to worry about him coloring on anything or himself as they only work on the color wonder pages.  The best part are that these little markers actually fit into my little toddlers hads.  I've seen other color wonder markers and they are so big and these fit perfectly in his little hand and enjoys coloring.  I highly recommend these and the color wonder pages for little toddlers and peace of mind for mommies!

title: Great pretend play toy!
text: My son loves this push broom.  I got him this and the dyson vacuum toy since we have a dyson that he was obsessed with.  Of course, he likes the broom better than vacuum which was more expensive.  My son is 21 months and he gets this out probably every day.  He loves to drag it around and pretend like he is sweeping like mommy and daddy.  Great pretend toy especially for the price.  I even used it the other day to push some leaves out of the storm door so it works for adults too.  :)

title: As described, no problems
text: The balloons were just as described.  We didn't end up blowing these up so I am not sure if there were any holes.  We used them for a balloon wreath since the price on Amazon was a better deal than my local craft store.  They served our purpose and looked great on the wreath.

title: Great to use with Finger Paint
text: Bought this along with Crayola Giant fingerpaint and a smock for my 4 year old nephew for his birthday.  I had no idea that they make paper for finger paint.  The paper is slick so it makes it easier for the kids to paint on the pages and its a larger size so it gives them more room for the paint since no kids likes to paint with their hands on a small piece of paper. I definitely recommend buying the paper with the finger paint.  I had a great time myself doing this with him.

title: Great for art projects and fingerpainting
text: Bought this along with Crayola Giant fingerpaint and paper  for my 4 year old nephew for his birthday.  This fit him nicely and he managed not to get any paint on his shirt.  He did manage to get some on his pants but that's because he is 4 and he likes wiping his hands on his pants.  I would recommend getting one of these if you plan buying the fingerpaint.  Made clean up much easier.

title: Great present for a 4 year old
text: Bought this along with Crayola Giant fingerpaint paper and a smock for my 4 year old nephew for his birthday.  I was very pleased with the fact these were washable.  I helped him paint a few pics myself and it washed off very easily off my hands, the kitchen counter and his clothes.  I bought him a crayola smock as well but he still managed to rub it on his pants.  I was very pleased that it came off.  I would highly recommend these.  It was a lot of fun for him and me!

title: Great case for iPod
text:
This toy is great in theory...We have an old iPod we got free with our computer that we never use so I put that in here for my 9 month old at the time. He loves our iPhones and is always trying to grab at those so I thought this would be a great toy for him. Unfortunately he's not interested in it at all. The apps are easy to download and are great learning tools however, there is one of the apps that makes an annoying sound and won't go to the next screen unless you touch it. He might like it as he gets older but for now, it just sits in our toy box.

However, this has made for a great toy for my friends kids that are 3 or older but not to play with the FP apps. They want to play other apps on the iPod so it does make for a good case for toddlers. One dropped it on the concrete and hardwood floor and didn't break and did no damage to iPod or the case for that matter.

Overall, this is a great case for toddlers but as a learning toy (it's just ok).

title: One of my son's favorite toys
text: We gave this to my 10 month old for Christmas.  He loves it!  It has three different settings (learning, music and bedtime music).  My son loves music and light up toys.  This one definitely fit the bill.  He also likes to spin things.  On the front there is a little spinner that he loves to play with.  He loves just looking at the lantern light up and sing.  I bought this thinking he would like this more as a toddler than now since it doubles as a type of flashlight for toddlers to use and the bedtime music so it was my surprise to find that he already loves it.  I would recommend this for 9months to 4 or 5 year olds.  My 4 year old nephew thought it was really cool and wanted one as well.

title: Fun game!
text: I bought this gift for a friend's birthday.  She was thrilled.  This is her favorite game.  It's super fun and great game to play in groups.  I would recommend this game for any adults or game night groups looking for a different yet fun game to get everyone involved and interactive.  The game has great challenges.  If you like Cranium, you will most likely like this game.

title: Disappointed but still a good toy
text: I bought this toy for my friend's daughter's 6th birthday.  She loved it!  I really like the fact that she could cut the fruit instead of those plastic fruit pieces you can by at the store.  Also, like the crate it came in which was very sturdy and worked as a great cutting board for her fruit.  I was disappointed because I thought these were magnetic not velcro and maybe I should of read the reviews before I bought the set.  The velcro worked however, like other reviewers the pieces didn't fit together as good as I would of liked.  They are great for cutting but for pretend playing and pretending its a whole piece of fruit would be rather difficult for it to stay together.  I think the toy was great, she loved it which is what mattered but for the price, I guess I expected a little more.

title: Super cute but thin
text: I bought this costume as a gift for a friend for her grandson.  She loved the costume.  He was super cute in it and it's really true to size.  It fit him perfectly.  I was looking for a pirate costume for an infant everywhere and I was glad I found this on Amazon.  I really don't have any complaints however, my friend had a hard time putting it on her grandson because she didn't see there were button on the pants besides the opening in the back.  I had to show her there were snaps on the pants since it wasn't very apparent unless you were looking for them.  I only knew because my son's lion costume was the same way.  Also, I would mention that it was thin so it wouldn't be a good costume to wear without a coat if your Halloween's are like the Midwest where it's typically very cold on Halloween.

title: Great Bumper
text: I bought this for my husband's Traxxas RTR 1/10 Stampede with Water Proof XL-5 and 7 Cell Battery RC based on other reviewers recommendations.  I am very glad I did.  I got my husband his first RC for Father's Day this year.  Since this is his first RC I wanted to make sure we got all of extra's we needed.  This is definitely a must.  This really does protect the front and my husband was very pleased that I had made this additional purchase for his truck.  He also thought it made it look a little tougher.  I would definitely recommend this small purchase for the protection of your RC.

title: Best Father's Day gift
text: I bought this for my husband as a Father's Day gift for my husband.  He actually wanted to the Traxxas RTR 1/10 Stampede 4x4 VXL 2.4 GHz however, I wasn't wanting to spend the price tag quite yet as this is his first RC.  Before I spent a lot of money, I want to make sure my husband is really going to enjoy it AND USE it before I spend the price tag on the next one.  I was very hesitant in purchasing this since this wasn't exactly the same one he wanted but I am glad I didn't as my husband loves this one.  He mentioned that he was glad I got him this one because it's so fast that if he got the other one that's faster, he would of had an extremely hard time maneuvering.  He said this one was fast enough for him to learn on how to handle.  Additionally, this has been a very durable RC and he uses it in our Culdesac, street and even our yard.  He loves it!  I am very pleased with my purchase and would definitely recommend this for first time RC owners.

title: My son's favorite toy!
text: My son is 3 1/2 months old and this has been his favorite toy since he was 2 months old.  I love it because it plays beautiful music and it lights up which entertains my little guy.  I like it because we can clip this above on his play mat or put this in his bouncy with him.  He just loves it and always makes noises when he wants me to press the music again.  I would highly recommend this for new infants or presents for a baby shower.  Mine was given as a baby shower gift.  We absolutely love it!

title: Great Ball Pit :)
text: I ordered this pack so I could have one pool for a ball pit and one for the patio. So far, it seems durable and it fits a lot of balls (There are ~400 in the pool pictured). One note, you will probably want to use a pump, manual or automatic, to inflate this pool. You will definitely pass out if you try to blow it up without a pump.

title: A great addition to the Paw Patrol Tower with one tiny exception......
text:
I purchased Zuma and the Hovercraft to go with our Paw Patrol Tower toy. It is the perfect size to park in his spot, It has wheels on the bottom, so it can be moved around and Zuma fits well inside.

The toy comes in two pieces, you have to snap the propeller on to the rest of the Hovercraft. It's very easy to do. It's also very easy to undo. Within two minutes of playing with the toy, my three year manages to remove the propellers every. single. time. She isn't quite able to snap it back in herself, so this results in "Mommy fix Zuma". Not such a big deal the first 200 times, somewhat annoying after that. However, it's nothing that some gorilla glue won't fix.

title: Not for Tiny Fingers!
text:
I purchased this for my three year old because our floor space is limited and I thought a pop-up dollhouse would be a nice compromise. I didn't realize how tiny it was until she had opened it. At one point, she got so frustrated trying to get the tiny furniture in the house and the tiny figures to do anything, she started crying - not a great start for a gift. I decided to return this and get something a little more tiny finger friendly.

I've seen a bunch of reviews about the doll figures breaking - they did seem kind of bendy and fragile and the arms were hard to get just right. The hand sanitizer in the picture is to show you to scale the size of the dolls.

title: Okay individual colors - sometimes weird when combined and requires effort to get a 3 color line.
text:
Soooo, I had high hopes for these markers. I thought my little one would be highly amused by writing in three colors at once (she was mildly amused for a short period of time). I think the issue is that in order to get the even three color lines when writing or stamping or coloring, you have to hold the marker perfectly upright and ensure all three tips are somewhat evenly on the paper. This is not easy for little hands (my little one is almost 3). I myself had to concentrate to create the images I posted. It's much easier to end up with 2 of the colors in a line or even one depending on how you hold the marker.

The colors individually are nice, but sometimes when they cross over, they create kind of ugly mixes and combinations. Again, this depends on how steadily you hold the marker and what colors you have on top or bottom (as shown by the squiggles under my first picture).

All in all, I would call this an interesting novelty - for slightly older kids. I'm guessing my little one might make some stamps and then these will go in with the rest of the markers. If she was doing more freeform drawing - it might be more amusing.

title: Great (very large) stickers
text:
We use these stickers to reward poo poo on the potty (we use smaller ones for a #1). My little one loves these stickers. They are pretty big and unfortunately she loves to stick them on her arms (and mine) - warning they are VERY sticky and hurt coming off.

I have also used these stickers in goody bags and for valentines - they are of the size that almost any kid would really love.

title: Great potty and chore reward stickers!
text:
My Little one loves stickers and Sesame Street...This makes these stickers perfect.

There are three different types of stickers - 2 pages each. This includes:
- Round Stickers
- Small round stickers
- and 2 different sizes of rectangle/square stickers

Some of the stickers are just of Sesame Street characters and others have encouraging messages. We use these to reward trips to the potty and mark chore charts. There are also a fair amount of them used to stick to hands, shirts, walls, and everything else. For the price, we can afford to be generous with the stickers.

title: Great multi-sensory Puzzles with a few nits
text:
My Tot is obsessed with numbers, colors, shapes, and letters. These puzzles are a great way to practice all of the above.

What we like:
- Very Bright and Colorful
- Seems sturdy. It's clearly made of wood. The base and the pieces are pretty thick. I can't bend them, so I'm assuming the Little one can't either
- Engages multiple senses and areas of learning. Each letter piece has a picture and word of something starting with that letter under it. For example Z has a picture of a zipper and the word zipper. The numbers have the number spelled out and then that number stamps of some shape. For example the 2 piece has 2 red hearts so we can practice colors, words, shapes, and counting at once.
- The pieces are made into animals or have eyes in certain places - it's very cute.

The few nits (things to note)
- The images are painted on to unfinished wood. That means it can be easy to scratch a piece and lose some color. I think the colors will also fade over time because there doesn't seem to be a finish sealing everything.
- Some of the pieces are hard to get just right into their places. We have consistent problems with the G. Not a big deal, but can cause toddler frustration.

I will note that when you open the puzzles, go through and remove each piece before the kiddo does to loosen it up. Our first play session, some of the pieces were sticking and even harder to get back into place. It has all smoothed out as she plays with the puzzles more.

All in all, I think this is a great product and we love it despite the few little nits I noted above.

title: Durable multi-sensory toy
text:
This is a great book for babies. My little one started playing with this at around 10 months. She loved all things that sing and light up and this was an excellent way to start reading to her and letting her hear sounds and words. I could also sing her the word to the songs as well.

This toy has two volume controls, which is a godsend. She enjoyed flipping the pages, playing the songs and hearing all the bonus noises from the levers on the pages. This toy is quite sturdy. It's been tossed around and still works perfectly. Just when I think she's outgrown this toy, she'll pull it out again.

The songs include Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, Mary Had a Little Lamb, Little Bo Peep, Hey Diddle Diddle, Three Little Kittens, and B-I-N-G-O.

title: Fun toy for little ones.
text:
I purchased this flashlight for my little one when she was just under a year old. She loved looking (and I mean directly into) the lights and the sounds that the flashlight makes.

This flashlight is sturdy and well made. There are two volume options (a godsend around the 200th time she presses one of the buttons). We've had this toy over a year and she comes back to it periodically and loves to stare into the light. I'm glad the lights aren't very strong or she surely would have blinded herself by now.

title: Excellent Addition to our VTech Car Collection
text:
[[VIDEOID:6dd9f0747ca46ff3c95c107e42f25de5]] My little one received the Mickey Mouse Train set by VTech for Christmas. Over a few months, I managed to collect several of the characters until we had the whole crew except for Daisy.

My little one was thrilled to get this Daisy and like our other VTech cars, she is loud, she sings 3 or 4 different songs, her headlights blink on with the songs and she is pretty darn durable. We play with these cars on our VTech track, on the floor, we send them flying down the slide like a crash ramp and sometimes we throw them because why the heck not? This has an of/off switch and only one volume.

title: Super Durable, engaging sounds, boring screen.
text:
I purchased this toy in a desperate attempt to save my own laptop from my 6 month old. She loves to bang on the keys of my laptop whenever it's open and I thought if she had her own, perhaps we could both get some “work” done in peace. Alas, she still prefers to bang on my laptop. However, she does enjoy this toy.

She has definitely grown into it more at 20 months. She likes all three modes and I like that it has volume control. The mouse is an actual mouse that loves (very cute). One somewhat freaky downside is if the laptop is closed, but powered on and you accidentally hit the mouse or jiggle any part of it - it begs you to “Open the laptop to learn”. Great if you know it's there or the kid is playing with it (banging it around) with the kid closed. Freaky if it's in the middle of the night and gets jostled somehow and you hear that freaky voice from nowhere.

This thing is durable. I have had it for over a year now and LO has thrown it banged it, spent the first few months just lifting the lid and slamming it down again (not gently) and so forth. I was sure it would not last a year, but it's still ticking.

Downside, the screen is like light up dots - probably helps with durability, but doesn't really make it realistic. It also kind of Boring (the screen). It doesn't light up different colors or engage all that much. It flashes and scrolls. They should definitely work on that for a next version. Boring screen made it lose one star overall.

Songs are catchy. I find myself singing them at work “1,2,3,4,5 circles, triangles, squares ....” and so on. Blessing and a curse. Little one likes to play on the piano keys and it will sound out a song while she plays. For a minute I thought my kid was a prodigy playing row row your boat - then I realized she didn't have enough notes on the keyboard... Alas, I bet hearing it while she “plays” makes her feel smart. All in all, a good purchase.

title: It's not quiet and a nightmare to assemble, but my kid loves it!
text:
Okay.... I am a person that finds assembling Ikea furniture to be somewhat relaxing. I don't mind assembly. This was hands down the WORST thing i've ever put together and I have an Ikea wardrobe system I put together myself. It came out of the box as a pink shell and a myriad of wheels, plastic pieces, axles, stickers, etc. the directions sheet was like a bad fax. The pictures were so dark you could barely see how thing fit together and there were no words only letters that label pieces you can barely make out. In order to get the wheels on the axles and on the car, you have to use pliers and a wrench at the same time - be prepared to be handy to get this together and to contemplate tossing the whole thing out the door. A few hours later we had a functioning car that felt generally stable. I'm still not entirely sure the seat belt is on the right way, but after assembling it 4 different ways, there just doesn't seem to be a right way and I holds the little one in place, so I gave up.

It's pretty roomy. The cup holders fit bottles of water, cans, and of course sippy cups. My LO is 18 months and dits fine and will enable to ride in this for a long time to come. She loves to go for walks in this. I have to be careful about the time of day since there is no sunshade.

Now, I paid extra for the whisper quiet version of this toy. Don't bother. It is NOT quiet. It tumbled along the side walk pretty loudly. I can only imagine what the non-whisper quiet version is like. I don't think the noise reduction. Is worth the extra cost as it's loud. It also doesn't maneuver worth a darn. If you need to turn, move to the side, or anything that is not just straight, you basically end up dragging it. It goes over most bumps okay, but we have hit a few large sidewalk bumps that caused us to have to pop a wheelie.

My kid loves this thing. I'll forever have nightmares about having to assemble it and then listen to it rumble through the streets.

title: It's a ball..it bounces. It has spikes. My LO loses interest pretty quickly.
text: So, this ball is like a big spiky bouncy ball. It will definitely bounce and that's one nice thing. It doesn't particularly bounce high. The spikes aren't hard and don't hurt when the baby "catches" the ball. We mostly roll this back and forth and occasionally bounce it. I don't notice that she spends any particular amount of time with this ball versus other balls and since it doesn't sing or light-up, my little one loses interest rather quickly.

title: I was told there were "Okay" cards in these packs.
text: I know nothing of Pokemon. Nothing. I purchased these cards for my godson and his brother based on the reviews and hoping they would have some good cards they didn't previously have. The verdict from them was "They were okay." Now, since it's a sampler pack - i'd imagine some packs have better cards than others. Just luck of the draw.

title: I hate this darn thing - meaning my kid LOVES it!
text:
For the record, I rue the day I purchased this ball popper for all of the reasons my little one loves it.

With the press of a the smiley faced lever thing, she is fascinated by extremely loud carnival sounding music and balls popping out of tube, into the tray (sometimes - or around the room other times) and another ball popping out - rinse and repeat. If you only have 3 of the balls going at once, most of the time, they will pop out of the toy into the tray. If you have more than that, then chances are they are going to be flying around the living room. The balls are a nice size, so no worries about little ones choking on them. The opening of the toy is big enough to fit legos and other things (they will not pop up - they are too heavy). It's also easy to extract the legos from the tube by turning the toy over and yes, my little one likes to put her big legos (and anything else that will fit) in this toy in hopes of seeing it pop up. Thank goodness, nothing else seems to work besides the light balls included.

My only real complain with this toy is it only has one volume - REALLY FREAKING LOUD (which is why it got 4 stars instead of 5). Many of the toys we've purchased have two volume options so you can put it on the lower volume when you are watching TV, trying to think, or just want some peace of mind. This one doesn't have that and it's so loud. Have I mentioned it's loud? We have a lot of noisy toys and only two of them bother me, this one and the Dora microphone.

With that said, my kid really enjoys this and it will keep her occupied for precious minutes at a time. If you can stand the noise - this is definitely a winner.

title: It's a ball that sings, kind of - my kid likes it okay.
text:
My 15 month old likes this toy well enough. She is a huge fan of anything that sings and makes noise, so I thought this might be an interesting diversion and keep her occupied longer than a regular ball. She will play with it and enjoys it, but probably not much more than any other ball. It's probably blasphemy to say, but the volume of the ball might be a bit too low (every toy should have multi-volume controls, at least a low and high volume). I know a lot of kids like the tags, but mine has never taken much of an interest in them despite me buying her several things with tags.

The battery compartment is secure enough. She has not yet figured out to open it, although I assume at some point she will.

title: So many Shark Songs - My Toddler LOVES it. My feelings are mixed.
text:
First of all, the answer is yes, you do get the full Baby Shark song with one press of your little one's finger with this book. Depending on if that is press #1 or #201 likely depends on how much you will love that feature.

With that said, my 15 month old LOVES this book. She quickly got the hang of pushing the buttons to hear the songs and it entertains her for minutes on end (which is a long time in Toddler time). Seriously, she'll sit with this book for a good 20-30 minutes listening to all the songs.

Besides baby Shark, there are 9 other Shark themed hits that you will recognize Like "There was a yellow shark and shark was his name OH, S-H-A-R-K" (sang to the tune of There was a farmer who had a dog) and twinkle twinkle little shark. There is even a holiday remix of Baby Shark.

Your kid will love this book. You will hate this book until you realize you got 20 minutes of peace, then you'll just sing along to Where is Daddy Shark and accept it.

title: Overshadowed by the Baby Shark Book (unfortunately), but still great
text:
I purchased this book at the same time I purchased the Baby Shark Song book thinking I might get a bit of variety in my life. Just my luck, my little one loves the baby shark book and hardly plays with this one. I'm hoping she'll tire of shark songs and use this book soon.

With that said, this is a great book. It has traditional songs and lyrics like I'm a Little Teapot. The full song plays at the touch of your little ones finger and there are 10 songs to pick from.

My little one loves "reading" books and loves music, so these books are perfect. She plays all of the songs while flipping through the pages and it provides minutes of precious entertainment (yes, I meant minutes, she is a toddler after all... NOTHING provides hours of entertainment).

title: Light and portable. A little difficult to fold.
text: I purchased this to take on a cruise so my 1 year old could splash and play on deck and at the beach. SHE LOVED IT. It's just big enough for a 22 pound one year old. You might be able to squeeze two babies in. It's very light and as advertised just pops open. I took one star off because the thing is quite difficult to fold back up into the carrying case. I tried it before we left and did not use the cover part most of the time because it was such a nuisance to fold back up - not impossible, but there is certainly an art to it. Other than that, this little pool is great and VERY portable.

title: Great to hang, perhaps not to wear.
text:
I did not purchase these hats to wear, although a few party guests did try to put them on their heads and they didn't really fit - so you may want to avoid these for adult parties where you want them used as hats. These would likely fit just fine on kids heads.

I used them as hanging decorations for a wonderland themed party and they were great for that use. We got some invisible wire and hung them from the ceilings. They were a great splash of color.

title: The flight suit is quite complicated.
text: I purchased this for my three year old godson. He really enjoyed it. The flight suit is hella complicated. My husband spent a good 20 minutes trying to attach it to Hal's body and we still had pieces left over. We eventually abandoned it. I imagine that once the suit is on it will stay on or the poor kid will never actually use it. Other than that, nice action figure.

title: Nice Action Figure.
text: I purchased this for my three year old godson. It was pretty small (as expected), but he really enjoyed it.

title: Good Activity - Don't forget you need to grow your beads...
text: I purchased this for my 6 year old niece. The first thing I have to note to every person purchasing any Orbeez toy is that it requires some pre-work. You need at least 4 hours to let the small beads grow. My niece enjoyed watching them grow and checking in on them (every 5 minutes), but if we were looking for an immediate activity, I would have been hosed. Other than that it was easy enough for her to use on her own. The crush and draw was a little more complicated, but she was able to follow the patterns here.

title: Nice marbles :)
text: Not much to say, these are your standard craft marbles. I use them to organize my make-up brushes and it works well. They also work good as decorative fillers.

title: Good set of multi-use markers.
text:
Overall, these are nice markers. Depending on the thickness of the pager you are coloring, they will not likely bleed through the page. There is a very wide and nice assortment of colors and you can do some blending since there are multiple shades of the same base color.

I have NOT smelled the scented markers, but I do believe a co-worker commented on the lemon scent of one yellow marker. All that to say, the scent isn't overpowering or anything for the few scented markers.

I had a few markers that seemed to bleed. Something leaked or broke and the ink ran down the side. I ended up throwing them away. I've also found that the points get flattened with use, so it's hard to color in tiny little spaces without going over the lines. This didn't happen at first, but the more I colored, the flatter the points got. All in all - depending on the book and the drawing, these are great markers, but may not last for the long haul.

title: Love the retro look!
text: I've been playing this game for 20+ years (yes, I think I just aged myself a lot). This is an ultimate family fun game. My old set was worn down and I saw these. I love them, they are so pretty and have a super cool retro look. A definite must for family game nights - especially after the Monopoly board has been flipped.

title: Full Face Not Full Head
text:
Maybe the manufacturer/seller wasn't sure of the product but this only covers the face. A full head mask should cover that, the entire head. This has a two elastic strap holding system, one goes around the head and the other goes over the top of the head and connects to the around the head strap in the back. There are no adjustment points on either strap. You could use a couple of paperclips and a piece of cardboard to make the mask fit a smaller or child's head.
The mask feels well made, the material was much thicker than i had expected with the straps securely attached. The texturing and artwork are rather similar to the advertisement although the shadows on mine could have been a bit darker but that's just nit-picking. The mask fit me well, snugly but not uncomfortably so. I could see well enough out of the existing eye holes without having to modify them. The nose holes did an okay job of disguising my own nose. I could breathe fairly well while wearing it. This mask looks quite spooky, it scared and annoyed my roommate (I'm in a nursing home) and annoyed my nurse. I'm quite satisfied with this mask. I would have preferred a full head piece but I have a deep hoodie.

title: Lots of Games
text:
This comes in a nice box in a sleeve. Quite suitable for gifting. The box includes the handheld unit, instructions, two cartridges with additional games and a pair of wired earbuds. These earbuds come with one set of tips instead of the usual small, medium and large tips. If I had to guess these had large tips installed. They would not fit in my adult ears so I doubt they'll fit any child's ear. Of note every time you turn the unit on (right hand side of the unit) the volume comes on playing music at its loudest setting. It take 4 presses of the volume button to get it muted. This is especially annoying if you're playing late and don't want to disturb others.
There's more than 180 games on this device. One complete game section is of educational and teaching games for kids. There's also puzzle games, action, table (no idea why it's called this), sports and relaxing games. Each category has approximately 30 games plus the main menu has an additional 18 games of various types. I played quite a few, I didn't do well at any but I was distracted for an hour or so and I expect I'll try more of the games as time goes by. My issues arise from arthritis and large adult hands. A child will be able to handle this far better than me.

title: Fun But Cheap
text: These are fun. I got them because even in our 50s my friend and I are still 12 at heart and like bopping each other over the head with these. These are not great. Quality and build are mediocre at best. The 'blade' part of the lightsaber doesn't fully retract into the handle there's easily 8-10 inches of blade/plastic sticking out of the handle. When fully extended (75% chance of snapping open with a wrist flip the rest of the time it stick closed) the blade is rather short and doesn't really feel like the lightsabers in the movies. The sounds it makes are also mediocre. It makes almost a lightsaber sound when you turn it on but then, just sitting there in your hand, it makes a VERY loud buzzing sound that in no way mimics the low hum the movie lightsabers make, it's grating and annoying. The sounds it makes when you strike the blade against something, that's not too bad. They're fun but not exceptional. I wasn't expecting aluminum handles or anything but I was seriously disappointed in the quality.

title: Hard to Solve!
text: The regular cube is difficult on its own. I mean you can learn the tricks and go for speed runs or just use them to zen out and relax after a long day's work. But these other cubes? The ones that add more lines that turn at angles to the square plane. OMG. . . I have two that look like modern art and I can't do a thing with them! Wow, these are hard!

title: Not The Greatest Quality, Not The Worst
text: This is a two piece system and came crushed and crammed into a small plastic bag. The nose was pressed inward and seems to have somewhat remembered that position so I need to reach up from inside repeatedly to push the nose into a more appealing position. The hair on the wig is not well glued in place and it tends to fall out in small wisps which get everywhere as does the glitter over the eye holes which just falls off if you touch it. It IS a creepy clown mask and I'm a full grown adult it fit, snugly but it fit. Very warm and hot but that's to be expected of a rubber mask that covers so much. The eye holes are large enough I was able to easily see where I was going and what I was doing. The only issue I had is I have a beard. As you can see in the posted image it hangs out weirdly from underneath and I wasn't able to tuck it up under without it popping back. Still, I'd wear this for halloween.

title: Adorable Squishy Toy
text: He is absolutely adorable. Squishy and cute. Fits in a pocket and smells. . . good. It actually took a day or two before the scent became strong enough to enjoy. Thankfully the scent, somewhere between cinnamon and cookies, doesn't rub off on your hands. You can squish him down into the palm of your hand and watch his little zombie body reinflate back to normal over and over (I have!) with no cracking or tearing, so far. An adorable decoration for Halloween or if you're like me, year round. My only disappointment being he can't stand on his own. Not that big a deal.

title: What's Not to Like?
text: These six 24-packs of crayons were divided up with six coloring books as part of a Christmas toy drive the tattoo shop I go to was holding. All six boxes were inspected carefully and none of the crayons were found to be broken. Color selection was decently varied so each of the six recipients would have a nice selection of colors from which to choose. I hope the kids enjoyed them!

title: Clever Kaleidoscope
text: The book that comes with this has some mildly interesting things to try. Bending light with a pretty poor plastic mirror. Learning about angles by bouncing a super ball. But the biggest attraction in this kit is the kaleidoscope you can fill with your own items to view. It has hard to adjust viewing angles but filling the watertight cup with small shells, coins, beads and my absolute favorite, googly plastic eyes! I filled it nearly full with several sizes of eyes and it was hysterical fun.

title: Low Quality Brushes
text: I got these on sale and I still think I paid too much. I noticed in the product picture that one brush looked a little off but for what they cost and because I plan on using these to finish printed 3D models not fine art painting. Out of ten brushes one or two would qualify as good. The others have unevenly cut profiles and one or two have split bristles that I'm going to have to trim before using. Much worse and I might have returned or tossed them nd started over with something a little better. But these are usable for painting plastic models so I'll keep them. I wouldn't recommend or buy these or this brand again.

title: Cute. . .
text: I mean it's cute and it will catch a kid's fancy for a few minutes but how much repeat play does it have? I'm a kid at heart. I love toys and games. This pack comes with a clear plastic dome that has a mild magnifying top it sits on a plastic base. I think this has the most play value. While you can stick a background from the included print material and put your little plastic monster(s) inside to look at you can also, preferably  take this outside and look at bugs and rocks and pieces of tree and plants up close. This alone should be improved, perhaps with several interchangeable magnifying lenses. The plastic monsters are. . . cute but they're small, non articulate, they don't do anything, although one had a hole in its belly so now it sits and spins on top of my 3D printer. You get two aliens in this pack, one who's loose and a second that's inside an egg made of, it foams like denture cleaner or Alka-Seltzer, some dye coated substance. You put it in a pan or pail of water, it foams a bit (it wasn't exciting) and out pops a little container with your second alien inside. There's some data sheet type information, taxonomy identification by body type and style. Interesting until you're done then it's done and on a shelf or in the closet gathering dust. It's an interesting item but I think it's attention time is seriously limited.

title: Well Made Playing Cards
text: These are beautiful playing cards. Heavy duty, durable, extremely well printed standard card and royalty suits. The back of the deck is an attractive snake, sword and branch print. My deck is advertised as blue but they're so dark they're nearly black. Still attractive though. Very stiff. Initially difficult to shuffle but they'll break in. The box is very pretty with embossed gold print and is also quite heavy duty. Very nice cards though they seem, at the time I write this, a little pricy. They are a premium product.

title: Craptastic J U N K !  {Edited: 01-22-18 Please Read}
text:
I'm only giving it two stars because it gives me the giggles making up scatological puns and toilet humor when I look at it or show it to friends otherwise It'd be a solid one (see!) trending down (I can't stop!). I don't know what the final price will be, I've seen it insanely high and just ridiculously high. To be honest, if I saw the in the Dollar Store FOR a dollar and no more I'd buy a dozen and send them to my sillier friends. Beyond a great joke gift this is junk. I doubt it would hold a child's attention for more than a couple minutes tops. It's fairly cheap, thin plastic that topples easily. The seat won't stay up (just like a real toilet). The spring that's supposed to shoot your. . . scat in the air fires the moment you let go of it. There's no way you can press it down, drop in one of the two turds it comes with (see image), close the lid and 'watch it fly' as per the instructions. I've managed the task twice out of dozens of attempts. It's very easy to clog the toilet (see image) and even if you get it right it doesn't fly, it plops (I can't help myself) an inch or two away. The toilet lacks a handle, a small detail but one that would add realism. The figures they come with are sloppily painted. At anything more than a buck it's overpriced and suitable only as a joke gift. Be kind, don't give this to your kids.

Edit 01-22-18: Being serious for a moment here. I wanted to comment on the 'Squishy' description in the product's title. While this company may produce similar toys that are soft and pliable the ones that came with this toilet launcher are NOT. They are hard plastic and a potential choking hazard. The arms on the 'log' are especially fragile and could easily be broken off. I feel the four (4) year old age limitation set by the manufacturer is much too young. Please, use caution when giving this product to younger children. Thank you.

title: Swing And A Miss For Me
text: I really wasn't impressed. I got this to amuse myself but I think giving it to a kid would be somewhat mean.  Even the shortest experiment takes quite a while to complete and while the box says 'Just Add Water' you need more than just water. Do you have clear, 16 oz. disposable plastic cups laying around? I don't, and you need them to do several of the experiments. The kit comes with three small cups and aa plastic cap to do certain experiments in. I think Just Add Water should be just that and come with everything necessary to do all the experiments and a larger warning that every experiment requires adult supervision. It would help to mention on the box that not everything necessary is included and some take quite time which might annoy some younger, impatient, children. In the end it's okay but I didn't go crazy over it and honestly wouldn't recommend the kit to any but the most science interested children who have adults who can be around to supervise as some of the chemicals included can be harmful.

title: Fun But Has Flaws
text:
whatever you do, don't just wrap this up and give it as a gift to a child, maybe they'd have better luck but it was a nightmare for me to get this out of the packaging. There's tape everywhere, including a cover over the screen. The unit itself it held in with clips you have to turn, a twist-tie that holds the stylus as well as tape that blocks the cord that holds the stylus in place.
On top of that nightmare it says to erase the screen turn the unit over and shake it four times. I've had a horrible time trying to get the screen to erase. I've shaken it 20 - 50 times and the picture I drew was still there. The I held it still and voilà the screen turned black. Sometimes the screen seems to erase in sections while it sits upright doing nothing. When it's working it's actually kind of fun. The stylus writes well thin and thick and the stampers are double sides and can leave stars, clouds, circle & crown plus the edges can be used to draw straight double lines a half inch apart on the screen. It's got some flaws but it can be a lot of fun to play with. I can't say it's a great toy, not with the hassles and problems it's given me plus, for some reason it takes two button batteries (it comes with them pre-installed but doesn't mention on average how long they'll last) that require a screwdriver and likely a trip to a specialty battery shop or some place that sells watch batteries as it doesn't say what size batteries it takes.

title: Tanks For The Fun!
text:
This this is awesome. For something that easily sits on the palm of your hand the detail is pretty sharp. It honestly looks like a World War ][ Tiger tank with tons of details. I received the standard, mostly green, camouflage there's also a darker camouflage and a blue tank available. Colors appear to ship randomly. Remote control device coloring also seem to match the tank you get.
This little thing really zips around. I was surprised at how quick it gets up and goes. There's also a super speed button on the controller that adds fifty percent to the speed of the tank. There's also engine noises and what I'm guessing are 'track' sounds are this races around. The turret will turn 360° in one direction, I found going one way the barrel would hang up on the antenna but the turret rotation switches back and forth as you rotate. The barrel also raises and lowers as the turret turns. When you press the fire button there's the sound of a cannon firing and the entire tank body recoils backwards.
The remote control takes four double A batteries and the tank itself charges from a cable attached to the side of the remote. Charging time is fairly quick and I've already gotten several hours of fun out of the tank and it's still going strong. The only reason I can't give it four stars is the tank just won't drive in a straight line. You can someone adjust for the tendency to turn by steering left or right as you go but it would have been just that much cooler if it had driven in a straight line. Still, I'm a fully grown adult and this is one of my favorite things. It's just such a gas to play with.
I received this item in exchange for my review.

title: Color My World. . .
text: The old favorite from our childhood. A very nice, wide selection of colors. While the names may have changed (to protect the easily offended) the colors and quality of the crayons themselves are, as far as my memory is concerned, identical to the crayons I used forty five years ago. The box the crayons come in on the other hand is much thinner and flimsy than the boxes of the past. I like the new, to me, location of the sharpener which does an okay job and has a decent amount of space for shavings before it needs to be emptied. Do be careful though. I found the bottom flap flopped open too easily and is likely to make a mess. I think I'll put a small piece of tape on the box to hold the bottom closed.

title: Great To Color With

These pencils sharpen well in our electric sharpener and stay sharp for quite a long time allowing for precise coloring of narrow and small spaces. The box is a little cheap and easy to crush but the pencils are worth the price.

Also don't travel well in a rug so you need a smooth surface for best performance.

Maybe better for a 3-4 year old because you have to push down when pulling backward to launch, but I think he will grow into it. He does, love dinosaurs and these are sturdy so far, not breakage and they all work.

title: Best Instructions ever and best value because of brakes.
text:
We bought this wagon for our toddler grandson. I don't like putting things together so when I opened it I wasn't thrilled. First off, i couldn't find the hardware--nuts and bolts. I found them in the bigger wheel package. From there it was a breeze. Instructions were pictures and showed pics of correct bolts, etc., to use at each point. 20 minutes later, I was done.

This is probably the best instruction book I have ever seen. I did watch a 3 1/2 minute You Tube video a few times but didn't have to refer to it with these instructions. You can also see a video on Radio Flyer's web site when you register online.

This stroller wagon was better built than the pull only wagon and well worth the extra 50 bucks. Has a better handle, push handle on the back, bigger rear tires, and easy mount canopy, I was concerned the pull handle wouldn't be long enough for me, a 6-foot-3 grandfather with aging back, but the extended length it was plenty long enough for me.

The push handle adjusts to several positions, one of them being about the same height as your regular stroller. It's long enough for one or two kids and has harnesses at both ends with room for a few toys. Pockets on one end for water bottles for you or juice bottles for children. It has a pocket on the other side but it doesn't open wide enough except for a few magazines (think behind the seat pockets on airplanes).

The back wheels are BIG and the stroller is wider in back than front. Oh, and it has an easy brake system on it unlike the cheaper handle only version. Spend the extra 50 dollars for this feature alone. It will still easily fit between doorways and folds up easily also by pulling a handle strap in the middle of the wagon. It folds up tight, but may take a bit more room in the boot of your car.

I don't really have any cons about this wagon stroller. Except, I remember when wagons were more for kids than adult convenience. I mean, when they reach age 4 or 5, they can't stick a knee in it, steer with the handle, and push with their other foot for a smooth Radio Flyer ride like we used to do, can they. Luckily, they still have the pull for a ride with this model.

title: This should be a set or pair of toys.

I paid around $10 for this and it is really small. Think 2" in length. I tell you this as the descriptions are not adequate. I think the extra $ I paid is for the Thomas Brand name. title: Disappointed in the Brand Name Thomas and Friends
text:
I didn't expect anything great for the price and I knew this set would probably be small but I expected something a little better and bigger.

The wood tracks would be difficult for a three-year-old and my two-year-old grandson wouldn't be able to do it. Its not that the system is hard for a youngster to figure out, it's just that the tracks don't fit quite right and the train doesn't stay in the track grooves all that well, especially around corners. It's a rough cut and a youngster will likely derail here. Update Here: "My grandson has managed to put the tracks together except the bridge. Still, the pieces don't fit smoothly."

My next gripe is the plastic bridge that comes with it as the second straight piece. It is a sloped hill and when the engine and coal car go over it tends to derail over the hump. Additional cars make it do so more.

The cars are small and the track is about 18 "inches from end to end. The bodies are wood, but the wheels and lower frame are plastic. The detail is just OK. I bought the Percy engine and another engine with a back-hoe shovel for about $10 each bringing my total to about $42. I feel I didn't get much for the money.

If I had it to do again, I would probably just buy the vehicles and skip the set with track and let my grandson play with the cars on the floor. I bought the wood set probably out of nostalgia and because I thought it would be good quality. Quality is not that bad but not nearly as good as the old days. Next time I go to a fair and see someone selling home-made toys for kids, I'll buy one.

I thought I might add more pieces to this set and buy more tracks if the set was good, but will not now.

title: FP iXL Learning System Pink GREAT for Kids
text:
Purchased this for my granddaughter for Christmas. Very pleased with the purchase. Fisher Price makes such good products that live through all of the "crashes and drops of life". It is well built and sturdy. This product was an instant favorite with 3 1/2 year old granddaughter. She could work it and play with it immediately.
Pros:
* Size is just right for little people's hands.
* Software (after initial problem-see below) is well thought out for children
* Kids love it and it is the "go-to" favorite.
Cons:
* 2 of 3 extra purchase software titles would not "play" load to our computer(s) to then download to iXL. Received message to the effect that "internet access required". We of course had wireless internet access and it worked to download the first software title. We tried and tried on the other two but those two titles would not load. So,we called customer service, the FP customer service was great and the problems were solved quickly. The two titles that would not play were Version 1.0. The one title that would load was purchased at in retail store in another state and was, as luck would have it, Version 2.0. It loaded and played perfectly. Customer service (over the phone) had me give them the 20 digit number from each software package. FP sent replacement software ... Version 2.0 ... and they sent them quickly. BOTH RAN PERFECTLY.

We have purchased the case for the iXL. It is a nice place to keep it and makes it easier to find. This gets a lot of use. It is a purchase I would do again. In fact I have just purchased two more software titles and if there is a problem, I know we can remedy them very easily.

Good purchase, kids love it, so do parents and grandparents.

title: Fisher-Price iXL Learning System - pink
text: This was the absolute hit of Christmas.  Granddaughter is almost 4 and I couldn't believe what a hit this was.  She loved it ... and still does.  This is well built, it's been dropped and kept working - amazing.  Really like that the software can be downloaded on the system and you still have the discs in a safe place.  Note:  have had problems with two of the programs for this system.  Scooby-Doo and Mickey's playhouse both gave us error messages saying "need wireless network".  We will call Fisher-Price to find out why these won't down load.  The Disney Princesses software loaded right away - no problems and it is great along with the software that is factory installed.  This system has excellent learning tools, games, and is expandable with additional software.

title: If you are *COLOR BLIND*, you cannot play this game - seriously
text: This is a fun-sounding game, and I like both the gameplay and concept. It feels like a mashup of dominoes and scrabble, only with colors, too. ***HOWEVER*** if you are red-green color blind, don't bother. The colors on some of the tiles look very similar to those with this condition: blue and purple look identical to me, for example. This made playing the game much more difficult for me than it was for everyone else. In addition to the need to think spatially, and in terms of patterns and combinations of symbols, I also had the added challenge of not being able to tell which color was which--I literally had to ask for help figuring out the colors every single time. This was extremely frustrating and completely ruined the game for me. It was like torture. Not enjoyable or fun. I can see it being a lot of fun for those without color blindness, but for me, it was completely unplayable. I have attached a picture of the game tiles--if the top two rows of tiles look the same to you (as they do for me), you won't be able to play this game. I understand they make a version for the color-blind--awesome. Go find that and buy it instead.

Definitely not the same quality as another, similar gadget I own (I use these as fidget toys in my office). This is, simply put, a tiny piece of junk. I will be contacting Amazon to return it.

title: Love it. Review tells you how to play with 2 players properly
text: Brilliant strategy game. I did a little research and discovered the best way to play  with 2 players is the well-documented 2-player variant (found online, not in the instructions). Same game, only you reduce the size of the playing board to 19x19, just like in the travel version. You can do this by using one of the non-played colors to build a wall around the new playing area. Then, each player's first move is played starting on a square 5x5 in from the bottom left corner. Trust me, this works well. Addictive, and challenging. Will make your brain work! Love it.

title: Love the dominoes themselves - box is junk.

title: Glow only lasts about 20 min.
text: Was excited to get these. Followed the charging instructions (10 min in bright light). The glow only lasted about 20 min before it became impossible to read them. Worse, if you play in dim light, the low contrast of the painted glow numbers makes it hard to read them when the glow fades and you try straining your eyes to read them instead of relying on the glow. I may get a blacklight and try charging them with that instead to see if it helps, but I charged them under 8 really bright clear globes with poor results. Very, very disappointed. Cannot recommend. Save your money.

title: SMELLS LIKE PAINT THINNER-Nauseating to Try & Inflate
text: The balloons look cute-the cow print is nice. However as soon as you open the plastic packaging you are hit with a SUPER STRONG WHIFF of PAINT THINNER. There is NO WAY these balloons were made with any safe/legal paint/coloring/material. If I had a baby in the house, I would have immediately thrown them outside. As it was, we only blew up a few and the smell was so nauseating we felt sick and the entire 1st floor of our house smelled like we spilled paint thinner. I put the unused ones in a plastic bag and sealed it tight after deciding it was not worth the risk to my health to blow them up or have them in my house. The house STILL SMELLED like poison for several hours and into the next morning from the 4-5 balloons we did blow up. I would venture to say this is made with toxic material and it's definitely not worth exposing yourself to for cute balloons. The factory where these are made should be looked into; I worry about the workers!
