title: Nice little case...
text: This case is well constructed and we all know what TCG the colors reference.  My son keeps, what he considers, his favorite / best cards in this case so they don't get ruined.  It will definitely keep them from getting bent and torn up however, I do wish it had some sort of sleeve system for the cards.  It's basically an open box so if you want to further protect your cards, you'll have to come up with your own means before sticking them in here.  The zipper quality is decent enough but the most important part is my kid loves it.

title: Great little toy
text: This toy has definitely kept the interest of my nephew.  It's very well built and he plays with it for hours.  It's very well built.  A little smaller than I had expected but that doesn't take away the fun factor.  Of the toys my nephew plays with when he visits, this is by far his favorite.  I highly recommend it.

title: Great strap for holding your transmitter
text: This is a well made strap to hold your transmitter.  It comes with everything needed and installation was a breeze.  The added measure of security a simple strap can give is well worth it's cost vs accidentally dropping the transmitter and breaking it.  Definitely recommend this product if you want to preserve the longevity of your controller.  They're too fragile and expensive to not warrant a product like this.

title: Great building toy but felt a little misled
text: This is a great style building toy.  A new concept to me.  My children and I have been playing with these a fair bit and they are entertaining.  It's a nice change from the normal building blocks.  My kids love the colors.  They feel well manufactured.  If I had to make a complaint I would say that the listing makes it appear as if these are larger than they are.  They're quite small.  Definitely a choking hazard for the very young but they do provide plenty of entertainment.

title: Under the wrong impression but quality made cards
text: I was under the impression these were tarot cards when I had picked them out.  They are not.  Quite frankly these cards do not see much use by me but I can attest to the quality of the materials.  They are very well made compared to cheaper card material used.  Based on that and daily experience with playing cards, I can say these cards should last for quite some time.  I'm going to look further into how to use them or what their purpose is soon.  I can say, if you are looking for Tarot cards, this is not the deck for you.

title: Great case...
text: These cases are becoming a dime a dozen.  Pretty sure they're all the same but just rebranded under different company names.  So with that being said, generally you can purchase based on price from what I've seen.  This case is not much different than any of the others I've tried.  It works great though.  I definitely feel my drone is protected while in the case and the foam is cut nicely to handle all of the batteries, drone, controller, etc just fine.  I have no issues with this case and love it.  I will admit it has become my backup though as there was another brand I preferred just a little more but for no particular reason.  If that one ever breaks, I for certain will use this one.  Definitely worth the buy but like I said, there are plenty of other brands out there so maybe check to see which one is offering the better deal.

title: It's alright...
text: I'm not even sure how half these systems are legal unless the games are so old that Nintendo lost their licenses.  Regardless, you see these systems pop up all over the place and you're basically just getting a ton of Nintendo games from classic NES which are running through an emulator.  I'm old, so I was a kid when classic NES came out.  The games still hold their playability to this day, however, I rarely touch this thing.  My kids play it more than I do and once the battery dies it takes us weeks before we get around to charging it to play it again.  Basically what I'm saying is, it's nothing special.  The buttons are awkward.  I know they are giving you the B/A buttons and B/A turbo versions of the buttons but the configuration feels odd to me compared to any other controller out there.  If they rotated the button configuration 45 degrees it would feel more natural.  Many of the "500" games are just variants of the same game which is the same you see on most of these emulator products.  Basically it's nothing special, gets very little use by me, but my kids love it (when it's charged).  We haven't bothered with the TV connecting aspect because I have that Nintendo made one which we just added the ROMs we wanted to.

title: Well made case that serves its purpose.
text: When I saw this case I wanted to give it a shot.  I was looking through numerous styles and saw this one available so I snagged it.  The build quality is nice and everything fits in there perfectly.  The case is not a completely hard shell.  It will definitely protect the drone in the case of falls I would imagine however I would not stack anything heavy on top of this case unlike those air tight plastic cases with the double latches and all you see on here.  It's great for carrying your drone around over your shoulder and provides enough protection that you won't have to worry about anything happening while you're out and about.  If you don't want the expense of the hard shell cases, this is a good alternative.

title: It does what it's supposed to and does it well...
text: We're all just looking for something to protect our valuable screens.  Whether that be some super expensive polymer or some run of the mill piece of plastic.  Anything to take the damage instead of the screen itself.  Well this product is just another one of those protectors.  You get three screen protectors for the price which is nice.  They fit my RC controller perfectly and the air pockets were simple to push out using a plastic card.  The image is clear and screen response is just as accurate as prior to the installation.  The packaging is decent.  Overall, I am happy with this product.  If I had one con, it would be the lack of an instruction sheet, but we've all installed enough of these things by now to figure it out easily enough.

title: Fun for hours!
text: My son loves these! He's been collecting them for about three years now. The downfall is a lot of the packs are “blind” boxes or packages, so you could get a repeat toy. They are sturdy, they make great stocking stuffers, and a pretty good deal!

title: Got as a present
text:
My niece loves projects and so this seemed right up her alley. Unfortunately it seems the materials aren't that great and it's not very easy to complete the project. I am not sure if it's an age issue, she is 11 so it fits within the scope.

I gave it a 2 since it has promise, just wasnt the greatest here.

title: Some cool features, major downsides
text:
The tracks need to be on a flat hard surface since they don't really connect via any sort of locking mechanism. It is basically via friction and they come apart easy.

The train lights are cool and it does look cool in the dark. The remote is quite simple but was fun while we used.

The big downside is the train sits inside the tracks so it's clunky as it goes around (especially since tracks need to be just right or they disconnect or the train does).

And for whatever reason, you put a few drops of fresh water in the smoke stack and it smells like dirty socks. It was strong enough that my wife came home and tried to find them (facepalm).

Unfortunately we couldn't keep this one.

title: Fantastic
text:
I wasn't really wanting another item my son could use against his brother but he saw this as I was scrolling. After cleaning his room and being a helper for the day, we circled back and picked this up.

The little beacon inside should probably be superglued since it seems to be a good option for them to fight over but it seems to help “transform” the toy into a super toy.

The material is solid and it did hit the wood trim without issue and has survived a few hard falls (apparently when you are a superhero you have to swing as hard as possible).

In any case, it's definitely a win and I may have to buy a second one since his older brother doesn't think it's fair, but such is life. Highly recommend this one.

title: Fun little keychains
text:
These keychains are great and we use them as “pit favors” in robotics. They are made well and look great so I am looking forward to our team handing them out.

The rubber smell is a little potent so I did need to open up the packaging for a little bit (but a box of rubber is bound to have something like this occur to varying degrees).

Overall, made well, look cool, and don't seem like they'll easily break.

title: Super cool
text:
My kid loves this little spider. His brother is currently in the Robotics program for FIRST so I needed something that would help keep him occupied (but also with something kind of similar).

The spider is easy to operate and he's only 5 and handles it very well. The dog is not a huge fan nor is the cat but they will adapt. We are encouraging him to not drive it toward them for fun. In any case it works very well. It's hard to say it looks real lol, BUT it does last a decent length of time and is easy to operate.

The materials seem to be made of solid plastic that won't break easily. So far so good and my son is happy which is what counts the most!

title: Very cool
text:
The LEDs on these were perfect because we got the package in the evening so I got everything out and turned them on outside and then brought my 5 year old out to see them. He was in love watching the colors glide through the air as he grabbed one and turned in circles. His eyes lit up when I showed him that it attaches to a gun that shoots them off.
We played for about 45 minutes seeing who could shoot one the furthest. The wheels on them did work because we live in a subdivision and one was close to the road and rolled a bit.

We flew them in the grass so I don't know how much damage they'd take on if flying on pavement, but the grass worked perfect.

You do have to put these together and the fit is snug (kind of ideal so they stay together) but I'd suggest a parent handle this part. The stickers are next and if I didn't plan to surprise him, I would've let him put them on as they are fairly large.

Super happy!

title: Fantastic
text:
I love this product for two reasons:
1. It keeps my son occupied for hours
2. The structure holds up well as a backdrop for a booth setup (we can just drape a banner across it for expos).

My son loves it because he can build “forks” or as commonly known forts. He loves the ability to set up his own fort and then make adjustments if he wants to add a small room (apparently the ability to make rooms is ideal).

It builds a normal style fort and there is more of a cubby that can be made. If there were two sets it would take up our living room but he'd be able to make his fort into more of the house he wants. He loves it as is and likes to put his little foam couch in there and watch shows on a tablet.

The pieces are built well and though flexible they do hold up, especially when they tried to use multiple comforters on it and it started to lean. I helped them drape the comforters over more evenly and all was well in fortville.

Loving it, great buy!

title: So cool
text:
We have a giant spider we used last year that we put on our golf cart so I wanted something that would give the house an additional touch to where we had multiple giant spiders.

I will update with photos once I get the full setup complete but the material for the webbing is fairly easy to work with overall. Just go slow in unpacking it or it will tangle. Then be sure to have a means to firmly tack this to where you want it to be setup. We are having from the underside of our front porch cover down to the ground. I am using stakes to elevate it just above the bush in the yard (that way any wind sway of the bush will not cause this to have issues during the wind). I did also have some pvc pipe that I've used as a guide rail type means that I may use to secure this if it's another windy season.

The lights on this add a very cool touch and are kind of essential at night time to really let you know it's a spider on a web, and not a floating spider (equally as creepy though).

Overall super impressed and super pleased.

title: This was AWESOME
text:
I wanted something to help entertain my nephew and not drive my brother crazy as 2020 has been... 2020. They were stuck home for most of the summer and I missed my nephew's birthday so I wanted something cool and unique. This was both of those things!
The big benefit here is there is a target and it moves. That helps keep the focus on the target and not randomly shooting bullets throughout the house.
He LOVED it!

title: Glitchy, not a good purchase
text:
This product is not good. My son decided to use some of his birthday money for an item he wanted. He chose this helicopter (I previously owned a few like this from SYMA). It took a very long time to arrive and kept seeing delays, needless to say he wanted to use it right out of the box. I knew we'd need to charge it and get fresh batteries into the controller before use. We charged the helicopter and took a test flight in the house (no wind, no other RC's that would cause interference).

We tried to start the trimming process which seemed to go ok and took less than a minute. After that things went sideways (almost literally). Without touching the elevation lever, the helicopter shot up and hit the ceiling. I took over control just in case as it was new and I didn't want him to ruin his new toy. I had a feeling there was an issue because I could see the confusion on his face. After I took control I was able to get it to hover for a few seconds and without touching anything else it spun around twice in a circle. I thought that was odd, but it didn't hit the ceiling. My son thought I did something awesome and asked "how'd you do that", which I let him know I didn't. I was slowly lower the helicopter back down and it lost transmission and fell to the floor.

After that we tried to drain down the battery so we could go for a re-charge and not ruin the lithium ion battery by recharging it too soon. I changed the controller batteries to be safe. Once charged, we ran into the same issues on flight 2.

title: Fun toy, slightly on the cheap side for looks
text: This is a cool little toy and EVERY little kid loves the garbage truck when it goes by. My nephew was amped for this little toy. I felt that it looked a little cheap and like it may not last, but he loved it. The little trash cans and then the moving parts and sounds were an awesome bonus.

title: Better than expected
text:
I am incredibly pleased with this item. I was not sure if the pictures were going to make it better than when received, but they look fantastic.

The plastic does not look nor feel cheap. The remotes work perfect and also have a solid feel to them. The toy drill works well to help remove and replace the wheels. The little wrench serves as a good learning tool but the drill is really what the kids took to overall.

Toys tend to be made thinner and thinner as we need to rely on pictures versus in person. This one is better than expected.

I feel these will last for quite awhile and will make my kids very happy.

title: Solid car, durable, mostly as advertised
text:
[[VIDEOID:aa2775d9378faee66bb1b179a1e96566]] This car was for my son's birthday so the pressure was on as the reviews were mostly positive.

He loved it when he opened it, "that's cool!" was the exact response.
-There was no assembly necessary.
-One battery pack was in the car and needed to be connected and the spare battery was in a separate box.
-The controller did require batteries (not included).
-There was a usb charging cable for the car battery packs, but there is no wall plug (so a wall plug or usb connectable device is needed).

The battery was fully charged in the car so we got to test it right away. Good thing is that we crashed several times but no cosmetic damages (fish tank stand, kitchen table, wall (twice), coffee table, my legs (yes, both).

The car was pretty fast but not as fast as I anticipated. That is probably a good thing for my 8 year old as the crashes like meant speed was about right for his first time using this car. His birthday was a few days ago and he's played with it for several minutes each day since then with no need to charge that battery (or use the secondary battery thus far).

The battery does say it will need 3 hours to charge though so BE READY to get that second battery on the charger right when you get this car.

Overall, very satisfied. It is a 4/5 for us and would get a 5/5 if the controller came with batteries and USB charger had a wall plug.

title: Handy for a multitude of uses
text:
I received this as a free review sample. I own similar bags in various sizes from other brands and can attest that this one is as well made as the others.

This is absolutely waterproof with a caveat: you MUST follow the instructions to the letter, Those are printed on the package in which it comes, as well as provided in the product photos above. There is a slight learning curve, but once you get it down this bag will protect any gear that you can fit into it as long as you can do at least three rolls of the top.

While the description claims this is for boating and kayaking, it's also great for camping, hiking and general off-the-grid use. I've used similar bags for storing electronic gear while in harsh environments, as well as perishables. Do be aware that if you are using this in hot, sunny weather the interior can get very hot, very quickly, so if you are planning to store delicate electronics or perishables factor that characteristic into your planning.

title: Main value is it matches an entire line of products
text:
I received these as a free review sample. This napkin is a bit pricey considering that there are far nicer ones available for a lot less.

Granted, these are functional and do the trick (plus, folded they are kid-sized and even thicker). The main value is if you are purchasing a complete set of party items that are available from this brand these are a perfect match. In fact, you would have to look long and hard to get the same motif in the exact color.

Know, too, that these are not only for kids. They are perfect (when combined with plates, cups and other items from this line) for baby showers and It's a Girl celebrations.

If you are planning a themed party of celebration where this design is appropriate, grab these along with the rest of the items mentioned. If you are looking for just napkins, you may want to continue looking.

title: Not just for kids
text:
I received this as a free review sample months ago and have had a genuine occasion to use it. However it was for an 'It's a Boy!' celebration and not a children's party.

Outdoors this flaps too wildly in a slight breeze, but indoors it adds a festive touch in the appropriate room - and in an office setting it will definitely show the cubicle where the 'party' is happening. Therein lies the versatility of this set of flags. If twelve feet is too long all you have to do is double or triple up on the integrated cord (which is really flat piping.

There is a pink model for 'It's a Girl!' functions (or a young girl's party), as well as matching cups, party hats and plates/bowls. Parents, teachers and office managers/party coordinators will find this useful because it can be reused if you care for it between uses.

title: Could be a lot more fun with some improvements
text:
I received this as a review sample and spent some quality time with it. When you are actually operating it (i.e., playing) it is truly fun for a few reasons. First, it's simple to control versus some RC toys that require hand/eye coordination. Second, it's practically indestructible, and finally, it works well indoors and will not damage [most] furniture.

Where I think this can be improved is in the battery access and charging functions. Accessing the battery requires a screwdriver (not included) and accessing the screw that secures the battery compartment is awkward for some adult hands. Moreover, the battery pack is connected to a lock and release electrical connector that is bound to eventually fail over time due to handling and the relatively thin gauge wires. This could be resolved by sealing in the battery pack and using a micro USB charging port.

Despite the issue above, there are some nice features: the remote control is one of the better designed ones I have used (and I test a lot of RC toys). It has a hand grip and simplified controls. The realistic, working headlights are a nice feature, and the semi-inflated tires are also functional. For one thing, the tires provide a lot of traction across carpeted floors. This vehicle will even go across patches of grass outdoors, although it's best on concrete and hard surfaces.

I did not test the battery life, but gave it an intense twenty minute test drive both indoors and out, and the vehicle responded to every remote control command, including accelerating over uneven surfaces without problems. It was still going strong when I ended my tests and repackaged it for donation.

Bottom line: this is well made and fun - but it could be a lot more fun if recharging it was easier. A final note: when you unpack the box, carefully examine the packaging because there is an antenna, batteries and charger that are easy to overlook and toss by accident.

title: Starting point that can be wonderfully personalized
text:
Comdet's helpful April 7, 2014 review covered the physical aspects of this set, so I will not repeat those. My focus will be on how I use this set.

This is [hopefully] the core of a more personalized gift and not the sole way to thank the woman who brought you into the world. For me most of the items are fluff and filler to surround whatever it is that you give her - be it chocolates, jewelry, a bottle of gin or whatever.

There is one item included in this set that begs to be personalized and that is the photo frame. No matter what else you slip into the gift bag, the photo you select to place in that frame will probably bring more pleasure than any other gift(s) you decide to include. Choose carefully and wisely and you will make her day more special than you can imagine.

If I could change one thing, though, it would be to ditch the fake roses. Unless dear mom has allergies to flowers fake flowers send the wrong message in my opinion. Unless, of course, dear mom likes her wine out of a box, then the ones in this set are a perfect fit.

Seriously, this is the start of a mother's day gift, not the gift itself. It's what you add that shows how much you really appreciate the woman who gave you life!

title: I love the size
text:
What a perfect size for espresso! These cubes measure 2/3 an inch on each side, which makes them ideal for a two ounce espresso in a demitasse cup. The small size also works beautifully in a six ounce flute of moscato d'Asti.

Each box contains one pound of cubes - 198 per box - and each cube is a scant 10 calories and 2 grams of carbs. This is an easy way to measure your calorie and carb intake with coffees and teas.

If you tend to put too much sugar in those beverages, you can measure the nutritional impact of your normal usage, then scale back in precise increments. That is something you cannot easily do when measuring out by partial spoons.

I'll confess that I prefer [[ASIN:B00716PFYM La Perruche White Sugar Cubes]] when I can afford them, but these are more than adequate and are a sweeter deal (if you will permit me the pun.)

title: excellent
text:
They saved my ass. I was out on my first paid shoot with my drone, and my patch antenna had broken off my goggles inside my bag. Thankfully I had one of these, still in the box in my other bag, and replacing the patch antenna with it seems to have given me significantly better signal.

They are excellent and a great deal at the price they are!

I would recommend some clip on protectors for the cloverleaf, though as my race drone snapped one of the "leaves" off in a very hard crash. soldering it back in place fixed everything, though
